column5: Saturday I decided to stay close to home and try Belwood Lake.  I had fished it once before but only for a short time.  I was planning on doing some exploring but it was pretty windy so I ended up fishing a bay that was a bit more protected from the wind and didn't leave since we were getting steady fish, and I brought a friend who doesn't get out much so he was loving it.  We probably got about a dozen smallies like the one below and about a dozen pike.  Most of the pike were small but 3 were decent, not huge but big enough to pull back.  We only got a couple of the smallies on tubes and the rest were smashing crankbaits which was fun.  I was impressed with the number of fish we caught and a couple of the bass were pretty good size (low batteries in the camera = no proof of those ones).  Here was an average bass for the day...
Sounds like a great day on the water!  I'm jealous.
Great report and pic evster  That is a perfect fishing day in my book!  Looks like a ton of fun  Thanks for sharing Leechman
WTG Man.....Glad you are my partner for the Rice Lake do........  LOL BTW....my camera is good!!  Bill
Sound like some good action, gotta like that...

Great report. I fished Belwood in the spring from shore and caught some pretty decent pike. I also fished the dam and did well also. Never fished the lake from a boat but I hear there are some pretty big pike in there. Sounds like you did pretty good. Anyways thanks for sharing.
Nice smalie. Good day on Belwood. Where did you fish, close to the dam or far away from dam? Tight lines.
Nice Bass! I've driven past Bellwood and live fairly close. Do they allow outboards on that lake?

Yes they do, which is why I tend to wait until September to fish there.  It gets pretty busy out there.  Its a pretty deep lake.  They had already dropped the level quite a bit and it was still 45 feet deep in the middle.
Sounds like a great day, fish after fish, protected bay.  Gonna have to try Belwood once, sounds like an awsome place.
